description: ERECTION OF TWO STOREY EXTENSIONS TO REAR SIDE ON SOUTHERN SIDE OF EXISTING HOUSE  ERECTION OF TWO STOREY ADDITION ON NORTHERN SIDE FOR USE AS A TWO BEDROOM DWELLINGHOUSE AND FORMATION OF A NEW VEHICLE ACCESS
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.  Reason for Condition: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The garage(s) and/or car parking space(s) shown on the approved drawing 9105/103C & 104C shall be provided before commencement of the use of the land or building(s) hereby permitted and thereafter shall be kept free from obstruction and shall not be used for purposes other than the parking of vehicles in conjunction with the development hereby permitted.  Reason for Condition: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in order to prevent additional parking in surrounding streets which could be detrimental to amenity and prejudical to highway safety.

Condition : 3 - Details of the materials to be used for external surfaces of the building/extension shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced.  Reason for Condition: To ensure a satisfactory appearance for the development.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Development Order 1988 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting this Order)no additional windows shall be formed in the south elevation of the building without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority Reason for condition:To protect the privacy and amenities of the occupiers of adjoining residential properties.

Condition : 5 - Before the building/extension hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the south elevation of the extension shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.  Reason for condition:To protect the privacy and amenities of the occupiers of adjoining residential properties.

Condition : 6 - The open area around the building(s) as shown on drawing no. 9105/103C shall be permanently retained as an amenity space for the occupants of the residential units hereby permitted and shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason for Condition: To ensure provision of adequate amenity space and to protect the amenities of adjoining residents.

Condition : 7 - The garage(s) hereby permitted shall not be used other than for the parking of private motor vehicles and no trade or business shall be carried out therefrom.  Reason for Condition: To retain adequate off-street parking facilities.

Condition : 8 - The trees shown on the deposited plan 9105/103C as to be retained shall be retained and maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for Condition: To preserve and maintain the visual amenities and character of the locality.

Condition : 9 - No preparatory works, site clearance or building operations shall commence until the trees referred to in Condition 08 have been adequately protected by fencing or other suitable means of enclosure to a height of not less than 1.2 m and at a radius from the trunk as specified in BS5837 1991 Guide for Trees in relation to Construction (ie at the edge of the tree canopy or at a distance which is half the height of the tree (whichever is the greater)), unless otherwise agreed with the Local Authority. Such fencing shall be inspected and approved as acceptable by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works and maintained until the conclusion of all site and building operations.  Reason for condition: To ensure that the existing trees are not damaged or otherwise adversely affected during all site operations, and to preserve and maintain the visual amenities and character of the locality.

Condition : 10 - Any tree shown for retention, which is identified as being dead, dying, dangerous or mutilated, within three years from the completion of building works, thereby needing to be removed, shall be replaced by a semi-mature or mature tree of the same species or a tree of height, girth and species to be agreed with the Local Planning Authority. The replanting shall take place in the first available planting season.  Reason for condition: To preserve and maintain the visual amenities and character of the locality.

Condition : 11 - During the period of building operations, the area within the protective fencing shall not be disturbed unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: To preserve and maintain the visual amenities of the locality.

Condition : 12 - All new tree, shrub and ground cover planting shall be carried out during the first planting season after the completion of building operations on the site or within such longer period as may be agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and such planting shall be maintained, including the replacement of dead, dying or defective plants and trees, to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority for a period of three years unless otherwise agreed.  Reason for condition: To preserve and maintain the visual amenities and character of the locality.

Condition : 13 - Where paved surfaces pass beneath tree canopies, all excavation work shall be carried out by hand digging and porous filling shall be provided around the base of the tree or any such precautions as may be required by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: To preserve and maintain the visual amenities and character of the locality.
